PAD_FindBook.synopsis: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.

Tome.synopsis: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
Tome.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. loadlevel WLD_Main_A2. goto -648.75, -1.51, -361.753. Interact with Necromancy of ThayTo open book:1. Select Player Character2. In ReCon enter: SetCharacterOsirisFlag FOR_DangerousBook_State_HasTomeKey3. Interact with the Tome again.

VB_BookDestroyed.synopsis: Companion reaction to the player destroying the DangerousBook ('The Necromancy of Thay'). This book was clearly magical, whispering offers of dark power. You destroyed it by dropping it on the ground and blasting it with radiant damage. When you destroyed it, there were some spooky vfx. Most characters would see this as a good thing. Gale, Astarion wanted the book for themselves, however.

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.synopsis: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

PAD_FindBook_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FindBook_1.text: 'The Necromancy of Thay'? Ominous, but Gale might find it useful.

Tome_8.speaker: Narrator
Tome_8.text: *You feel its connection. Its longing to be opened - to share its secrets.*

Tome_96.speaker: Narrator
Tome_96.text: *You open the book to the first page, with its shifting glyphs and strange whispers.*

Tome_152.speaker: Narrator
Tome_152.text: *You open the book where you left off, the glyphs dancing before your eyes.*

Tome_132.speaker: Narrator
Tome_132.text: *You open the book where you left off, and the voices return, chiding you for your indecision.*

Tome_30.speaker: Narrator
Tome_30.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome_108.speaker: Narrator
Tome_108.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome_64.speaker: Player
Tome_64.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome_68.speaker: Narrator
Tome_68.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome_3.speaker: Narrator
Tome_3.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome_19.speaker: Narrator
Tome_19.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome_151.speaker: Narrator
Tome_151.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

Tome_95.speaker: Narrator
Tome_95.text: *Assailed from all sides, you careen through the text, absorbing knowledge you can barely comprehend. And yet, for all the violence, you start to see.*

Tome_35.speaker: Narrator
Tome_35.text: *As you look into the book's amethyst eyes, you can almost hear a voice. You just have to open the book, and it will be yours. Forever.*

Tome_72.speaker: Narrator
Tome_72.text: *Necromantic power flows from the pages of the book. There is nothing more for you here.*

Tome_104.speaker: Narrator
Tome_104.text: *The book is locked tight, with no visible keyhole - only an oval recess in the cover's mouth.*

Tome_4.speaker: Narrator
Tome_4.text: *You try to examine the book, but the longer you stare, the more those piercing, amethyst eyes draw you in.*
Tome_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: examining the cover, staring at the eyes

Tome_89.speaker: Narrator
Tome_89.text: *Beneath the allure, you feel the faintest echo of torment. There is great power in this book, but also great suffering.*

Tome_153.speaker: Lae'zel
Tome_153.text: A cursed book? How obvious. Whoever opens it deserves the fate that befalls them.

Tome_126.speaker: Shadowheart
Tome_126.text: Curious. Why don't you take a closer look... I'll observe from back here.

Tome_54.speaker: Karlach
Tome_54.text: Please don't open the creepy book.

Tome_7.speaker: Astarion
Tome_7.text: That looks terribly heavy. Why don't you let me carry it for you?

Tome_24.speaker: Wyll
Tome_24.text: We surely shouldn't just leave such a threat out, where anyone could stumble across it.

Tome_32.speaker: Player
Tome_32.text: Place the amethyst in the slot on the book's cover.

Tome_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places an amethyst in the book's cover. The book's latch springs open in the player's hands.

Tome_124.speaker: Narrator
Tome_124.text: *The book's pull is irresistible; you feel changed, bettered, for having opened it. Suddenly, you are capable of anything - felling mountains, darkening suns, conversing with the dead.*
Tome_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and is drawn to the pages.

Tome_134.speaker: Narrator
Tome_134.text: *So much promised... but what is sought in return?*
Tome_134.context: InternalNodeContext: Optional narration for sorcerer-tagged players.

Tome_121.speaker: Player
Tome_121.text: Well. Quite the page turner. I'll get back to it when I have more time to focus.
Tome_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snaps the book shut.InternalNodeContext: Astarion talking to himselfNodeContext: He could feel himself getting pulled into the book and had to fight to close it. He snaps back to the world a little shaken.

Tome_88.speaker: Narrator
Tome_88.text: *Glyphs shift gently before your eyes. Words slip into your mind, onto your lips, forming words you don't understand. And something is trying to reply.*
Tome_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Tome_109.speaker: Narrator
Tome_109.text: *The symbols dart beneath your eyes, warping and twisting. Your head throbs, but you almost understand.*
Tome_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Words continue to move on page, the visuals at the edge of the screen intesify

Tome_87.speaker: Narrator
Tome_87.text: *All you can see are those symbols. All you can hear are the whispers - there is nothing else.*
Tome_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the reader's reaction. Player would hear a bunch of indistinct voices talking at once

Tome_75.speaker: Player
Tome_75.text: Stay on the page, listen to the book. Try to connect with the magic bound within it.

Tome_82.speaker: Narrator
Tome_82.text: *The glyphs swarm impatiently. The book wants you to turn the page, to delve deeper. It's hungry.*
Tome_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Tome_86.speaker: Player
Tome_86.text: Refuse the book. Muster your willpower and force the magic to reveal its nature.

Tome_138.speaker: Narrator
Tome_138.text: *The glyphs seem to burn your inner eye, outraged at your denial.*
Tome_138.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of glyphs and shadows intensify. Instinct voices grow more agitated

Tome_28.speaker: Narrator
Tome_28.text: *Within the pages, you feel a feral thrashing. Living magic, driven mad by what it was used for...*
Tome_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Tome_81.speaker: Narrator
Tome_81.text: *Necromancy. The magical energies of all living things were stolen, corrupted, and sealed in this vile book. It wants someone to share in its insanity.*
Tome_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Tome_62.speaker: Player
Tome_62.text: Concentrate your energy on the book. Channel a sense of calm onto its pages.

Tome_52.speaker: Narrator
Tome_52.text: *The magic inside the book is too strong. The voices grow louder - a cacophony.*
Tome_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX intensifies again, reaching a peak.

Tome_150.speaker: Player
Tome_150.text: Channel your magic into the final line. 'Now poor Barry's got a hag he must marry.'

Tome_45.speaker: Narrator
Tome_45.text: *Your limerick's final line pierces something within the book's roiling, vengeful magic.*
Tome_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX eases and slows, then stops.

Tome_115.speaker: Narrator
Tome_115.text: *The voices falter, the anger quells. The magic seems to grow still and quiet, like a soothed beast.*
Tome_115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX eases and slows, then stops.

Tome_119.speaker: Narrator
Tome_119.text: *Nothing. Just old parchment covered in arcane symbols. The magic sleeps.*
Tome_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: All glyph/shadow VFX gone. Player looking downward at the page, observing

Tome_105.speaker: Narrator
Tome_105.text: *The heavy cover thumps shut with a strange finality.*

Tome_91.speaker: Narrator
Tome_91.text: *Pain grips your mind. The book will not be denied - it will make you read on, or force you to retreat.*
Tome_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of glyphs and shadows intensify. Instinct voices grow more agitated

Tome_127.speaker: Narrator
Tome_127.text: *All you can see are those symbols. All you can hear are the whispers - there is nothing else.*
Tome_127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the reader's reaction. Player would hear a bunch of indistinct voices talking at once

Tome_110.speaker: Player
Tome_110.text: Drown the book's voice with verse. 'There was a young hero called Barry...'

Tome_131.speaker: Player
Tome_131.text: '... Who had to best a tough quest and not tarry. It was going quite well, 'til he fell under a spell...'

Tome_40.speaker: Player
Tome_40.text: Turn to the next page, wary of any arcane tricks.

Tome_106.speaker: Narrator
Tome_106.text: *The symbols move aggressively, probing your mental defences, but you hold strong. For now.*

Tome_60.speaker: Player
Tome_60.text: Ask your patron to guard your mind and turn to the next page.

Tome_66.speaker: Narrator
Tome_66.text: *The symbols move aggressively, probing your mental defences. Your patron is there to defend you, but there's only so much they can do.*

Tome_117.speaker: Narrator
Tome_117.text: *The world around you is gone - you can only see those glyphs, only hear those voices.*
Tome_117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Words continue to move on page, the VFX reach their peak intensity at this page

Tome_123.speaker: Narrator
Tome_123.text: *You feel claws moving in the shadows. They pull at you, dragging you closer.*

Tome_101.speaker: Player
Tome_101.text: Urge your hand to turn another page.

Tome_71.speaker: Narrator
Tome_71.text: *The glyphs scream, branding your mind with strange runes. You see time rewritten - fate undone - your future thrumming with power.*

Tome_36.speaker: Narrator
Tome_36.text: *You struggle to cling to scraps of what you know - powerful necromancy, you're sure - but it darts away, leaving only Hells' screams.*

Tome_50.speaker: Narrator
Tome_50.text: *The book snaps closed. You've seen too much. What profane knowledge is now seared inside of you, you should never have known.*

Tome_76.speaker: Narrator
Tome_76.text: *The glyphs scream, searing your mind. You feel lost, tossed in a sea of arcane power you can neither control nor comprehend.*

Tome_69.speaker: Narrator
Tome_69.text: *You try to close the book, but claws tear at you from the darkness. You can feel them on your body - in your soul, scratching and tearing at your sanity.*

Tome_140.speaker: Narrator
Tome_140.text: *The claws try to grip your hands, try to stop you, but you slam the book shut before they can take you.*
Tome_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player slams the book shut

Tome_154.speaker: Narrator
Tome_154.text: *The whispers, the pain - it all disappears in an instant. You are yourself again.*

Tome_125.speaker: Player
Tome_125.text: Welcome the darkness in the name of your god and turn the page.

Tome_46.speaker: Player
Tome_46.text: Drink in the darkness, embracing it, and turn the page.

Tome_12.speaker: Player
Tome_12.text: Face the darkness with your own, delve deeper.

Tome_122.speaker: Narrator
Tome_122.text: *Every symbol seems to burn your eyes. You can feel them searing into your mind - into your soul.*

Tome_48.speaker: Narrator
Tome_48.text: *The whispers, the pain - it all disappears in an instant. You are yourself again.*

Tome_10.speaker: Player
Tome_10.text: Drop the tome, ready to destroy it.

Tome_25.speaker: Narrator
Tome_25.text: *You feel better the second the book is out of your hands.*
Tome_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: PC drops the book on the ground and draws their melee weapon.

Tome_133.speaker: Astarion
Tome_133.text: You can't be serious. Give it to me this instant!

Tome_149.speaker: Narrator
Tome_149.text: *The voices return. Louder. Stronger. Commanding you to stop...*

Tome_49.speaker: Narrator
Tome_49.text: *...but they have no hold on you. All you have to do is strike.*

Tome_47.speaker: Gale
Tome_47.text: What are you doing? That's no way to treat a book!

Tome_26.speaker: Astarion
Tome_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes the book and opens it

Tome_65.speaker: Narrator
Tome_65.text: *You don't know what he read, but it had an effect. His eyes are hungry, but pained.*

Tome_0.speaker: Astarion
Tome_0.text: Well. Quite the page turner. I'll get back to it when I have more time to focus.
Tome_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snaps the book shut.NodeContext: He could feel himself getting pulled into the book and had to fight to close it. He snaps back to the world a little shaken.

Tome_58.speaker: Player
Tome_58.text: Tuck the book into your pack.

Tome_98.speaker: Narrator
Tome_98.text: *You can sense something dark about this tome - something profane.*

Tome_94.speaker: Narrator
Tome_94.text: *You've seen similar books in wizards' libraries - a tome on Thayan magic. A rare and expensive find, but people have gone mad reading less dangerous texts.*

Tome_118.speaker: Narrator
Tome_118.text: *The book refuses to open - for you, at least.*

Tome_137.speaker: Narrator
Tome_137.text: *You've seen much of the book, but its most powerful secrets are guarded by indecipherable glyphs. Without a key, they may be locked away forever.*

Tome_145.speaker: Narrator
Tome_145.text: *As you look into the book's amethyst eyes, you can almost hear a voice. You just have to open the book, and it will be yours. Forever.*

VB_BookDestroyed_0.speaker: Player
VB_BookDestroyed_0.text: Well done. The world's better off without it.

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome_0.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.
